50 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark brown with a lot of sediment and a tan head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, and hops. Flavour is citrus, roasted malt, and a little chocolate  with a slightly bitter finish.
Smak och doft av humle, citrus, choklad, inslag av fikon, torkad frukt och en viss rökighet. Söt, rund och len med en tydlig grapebeska. Gott på fat.

Bottle from mane liquor.  Pours an almost jet black with a fluffy tanned head.  good lacing left around the glass.  Aromas of floral hops, citrus and roasted malts.  Choc and caramel tones in there too.  Taste is more hops! loads of hops and a huge malt backing make this beer a beast. coffee malts coming through nicely as it warms.  this beer is exceptional

Dark brown/black color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, earthy hops, chocolate, & some coffee; Flavor of slight roasted sweet malt, caramel, hops, citrus, and chocolate; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Overall, smooth and well crafted - I enjoyed it.
Ok BIPA. It has the right elements but just not enough of each. I was left wanting so much more!

18/01/2013 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Nera, densa, impenetrabile, schiuma non molto abbondante bianco sporca, non molto persistente. Al naso intensissimi sentori di luppolo, note fruttate e agrumate, malti tostati. In bocca è luppolatissima ma ha comunque una struttura di malti tostati ben percepibili, il finale è amaro e lungo. Un po eccessiva forse, nellamaro e nella gradazione alcolica. Buona, ma mi aspettavo qualcosa di più.

Chocolate, liquorice, and a slightly grassy floral note on the nose. Pours an almost completely opaque black, with a fine head that dissipates without leaving lacing. Bitter upfront malty flavour, with a medium body. Overall, more malty than the norm for black hopped ales (much more so than black IPAs). A little bit unbalanced IMO, the hops doesnt really come through, except in the bitterness.

0.5 l bottle. Dark brown with a medium offwhite head. Hops, roasted malts, fruity aroma. Roasted, caramel, hops and fruits. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a thinish looking black with a nice tan head.  Aromas of some serious roast, some floral hops. Taste is similar - theres really much more roast here than hops. I imagine itd be different if I were drinking it fresh at the brewery, but still this beer is very good. Its not a good black IPA, but it works well as an imperial porter. And since we dont rate to style, this is going to get a good score from me.  Roasty, slightly bitter finish. This is good. Yes.

500ml bottle in a tulip.  Pours very dark brown with a thick, light tan head.  Aroma of citrusy, grassy, and floral hops, plus a lot of roasted and caramel malts with chocolate and coffee notes.  Flavor the same with a big malty finish to go along with the hops.  Thicker, smooth texture.  A good beer.

500ml bottle from CASK Pub & Kitchen. Very dark brown colour, beige head. Roasted treacle hop aroma. Sweet hoppy flavour. Spicey chocolatey aftertaste. Like the Blues brothers / hops image. A great beer.

Bottle at HopCat.  Pours a pitch black color with a small head that lingers a bit.  Aroma is deep roasted malt and burnt wood with a hint of grassy hops.  Taste is very malty as well, very roasty with a hint of chocolate.  Only get a bit of hops in the finish with some bitterness.  Thick and chewy mouthfeel.  This might be closer to an Imperial Stout and its decent.  A bit too roasty and burnt for my liking though.  And needs more hops to be considered a Black IPA.
Slick feel, soft carbonation, long finish. Nice combination between the roast flavour, other malts and a nice hoppy bitter finish. Medium to full body.
Bottle shared by a friend. Clear brown pour with a thick tan head. Aroma of malt, grassy hops and roast. Malty flavor with molasses before a grassy hop finish.

0.5L bottle, Batch 509 from Nøgne Ø. 
(Compared with the new version brewed at De Proef, which is hard to believe that is supposed to be the same beer, so this rating is of the NØ version.)
Pours a black, viscous beer with tan, slightly foamy head. This settles slowly, leaving nice lacings on the glass.
The aroma is really full with roasty malts, toast and dark bread. Some chocolate and roasted coffee as well. Also some earthy notes, with a hint of barnyard.
Really full, creamy mouthfeel. Starts off tasting like an Imperial Stout. Complex sweetness then slowly fading into hoppy bitterness. Long bittersweet finish. Leaving me wanting more...

Bottle. Pours almost black, with an enormous creamy beige head. Aroma is burned malts, leather, liquorice and tar all nicely balanced against resiny, bitter hops. Nice full body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is bitter with burned malts and liquorice on top of orange peel and resin, as well as notes of tobacco and coffee. Finishes of with a long bitterness.

Pours a cloudy dark brown color with a medium tan head that recedes steadily. Small patches of lacing. Aroma of roasted malt and hops. Medium body with flavors of piney hops, sweet malt and dark chocolate. The finish is roasty up front with a resiny hops aftertaste. Above average overall.

Bottle shared with Veitafan. Has a pitch black colour with light beige head. Fruity hops in the aroma along with grapefruits, and some coffee and liqueur. Theres also some chocolate in the background. More fruit, grass and hops in the mouth, and anis in the end. The mouthfeel is soft, and a medium to heavy bitterness. In my opinion this ale is mostly a rich and well-balanced IPA.

Pours a quite dark brown body with a fairly large, light-brown, frothy to creamy head. It takes a long time before the head is reduced to an everlasting layer of froth, and a good deal of foam is stuck on the glass. The sweet aroma is relatively strong and encompasses a close to perfect malt/hop mix: roasted notes, coffee and fruits in the front, liquorice, caramel and some alcohol in the back. Moderate to light sweet initial taste, followed by a fantastic long and lingering heavy bitter hoppy fruity finish accompanied by roasted notes and coffee. Prominent but pleasant vinous alcohol notes. Some faint liquorice as well. Deeper into the bottle I think that the fresh hop notes start to become even more evident. The body is medium to full, the texture is oily and the carbonation is soft to moderate. A delicious brew! 
[50 cl bottle, enjoyed 1.5 years before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Vika,  Oslo]

Tap @ Real. Hazy brown pour with a short beige head leaving moderate lace. Nose is pretty malty for a black IPA, with choclate, caramel and pine notes. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Pine, toffee, chocolate, charcoal and a touch of brandy. Finish is long and chocolatey, with a touch of charcoal on the far end. Not my favorite black IPA, but competent. I’d like to see a stronger and more complex hop profile.

500ml bottle. Black colour with average, frothy, tan head. Hoppy aroma, a spicy touch, underlying dark malty notes with a roasty touch. Taste is citrussy hoppy, bitter and slightly peppery spicy, green onions, hints of coffee on the dark malty side. Nice.

Black colour with a beige head. Lovely aroma with some caramel, rich hoppy and a fine fruity note. Rich beautiful complex flavour. Fruity and malty. Lots of citric hoppiness. Outstanding![Bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika in Oslo, Norway]

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2014 Bottle, aroma of green hops, a little treacle underneath, some malt and a hint of apple. Rich malt and vibrantly hoppy body, with peppery dark fruit, a dark chocolate, burnt caramel and old wine finish. Lovely black IPA. Re-rate 2 years on, theres gravy and pine in the nose, roasty and brightly hoppy body with cocoa, burnt treacle, a very light mustiness, and a firm dry-bitterness. Still excellent.

Draft at Paradiso Georgetown. Pours a rich dark brown with a small beige head. Nose and flavor are rife with that classic combination of spruce hops and beautiful bitterness, along with roasted malt, bitter chocolate, and earthen dankness. Smooth for 8.5%. Very very tasty.

On tap @ pizzeria paradiso. 8.5% dark hazy brown pour with copper tints and an off white head. Aroma of piney hops, burnt caramel and a hint of dark fruit ( plums ). Taste starts hoppy but finishes sweet and slightly boozy, lots of dark fruits, plums. Very interesting, palate is heavy with good alcohol warmth and creamy carbonation. More of a hybrid style than a black IPA, its like a really hoppy dark English barleywine. Bastard beer but tasty nonetheless.

Draft @ When Pigs Fly. Served in a stem glass. Pitch black with exceptional retention. Aroma of citrus, grapefruit, and roast. Flavor is lots of roasted malt and chocolate with a huge burst of fresh citrus hops balances the brew to be on a perfect line between rich roast and bitter, fresh hops. The body and overall feel makes this lean on a very hoppy stout. Texture is dry and has tones of ash. If you find this on draft; order one without hesitation. Excellent!

Bottle. Pours a cloudy brown with a small beige head leaving sticky lacing along the glass. The aroma is pine and floral hops. Medium mouthfeel with a sweet roast malt with light hop and bitter finish. Hides alcohol decently, a good Black IPA from De Proef.

The aroma is pretty much like a stout with burnt malt, chocolate, coffee, and maybe a bit more hops. The appearance is dark brown with a large head. The taste is like the aroma with assertive bitterness. The palate is thin. Overall a Black IPA that is really a stout.

Strong and very dense brown head of fine bubbles.  Luscious aroma.  Very soft and sweet and fulfilling.  Sweet malts, light coffee, toffee, roasted grains and a tad of milk chocolate.  Not getting a lot of hops in the aroma but maybe because there is so much else going on in there.  Color is a very dark brown.  Bit more hops presence in the flavor but not very strong.  Bitter chocolate, roasted grains, sweet malts and molasses and a hint of burnt toast.  Very flavorful.  Only a hint of alcohol presence.  Bit oily on the palate with some lingering bitter chocolate, strong roastyness and some chalky bitterness.  This is a very strong and flavorful black IPA.  And a damn good one at that.

Tap fermentoren. Muddy brown/red with a reddish hue. Aroma:  rye bread, high malty, light smoke, deep caramel, liquorice, molasses, somy Spicy notes, you get the hops, grassy and fruity with hints of peach and citrus. Taste:  medium mouth feel, dusty, hints of chocolate, liquorice and coffee, light smoke, high malty, roasted, some roasted bitterness, creamy, peach, and a hint of grapefruit and resin, some Plantsap. More like a hoppy Porter than a  black ipa

Bottle pours black brown head. Smells and tastes of booze small amount hops bitter chocolate cake orange burnt molasses nice fizzy on tongue. Slight sweet dry bitter finish. Coffee. Slight stickiness to it. Awesome beer. For the style maybe more like a porter but really good.

Draft at the Lord Nelson Copenhagen. A light head but with very heavy lacing. Almost no aroma. Heavily hopped and a slightly sour metallic taste. Served cool which suited the beer. A little on the strong side at 8.5% so it deserves some respect, and not to be drunk in pints which I learnt to my cost :-)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark and Strong, but not too bitter., #MIB, #MenInBlack, #Dark, very #Strong, 8.5% Alcohol

Near black in colour with a long lasting medium sized tan head, excellent lacing.  The aroma is quite hoppy, chocolate covered oranges, cherries, some coffee.  The flavour is sweet, some molasses, oranges, more cherries, some black forest cake going on here.  Bitter mouthfeel, medium body, moderate/high carbonation.  Finishes long, bitter, sweet and quite fruity.

These black IPAs always seem to catch me off guard.  I dont think that I will ever quite understand them.  That said, this is good.

500ml bottle from the Premier Gourmet in Buffalo, New York.
Opened March 13, 2011.
No date.

Very light,  but sweet malts and fruity hops on the nose. Roasted malts with decent alcohol percentage give really nice body and play well with the bitter hops. Raisins, pepper and citrusy acid on the taste.

Nose:malts, sweetness, stuffy raisin
Taste:bitter hops , nice balanced sweetness.
Aftertaste: Dryness from hops, saaz maybe

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Last of the Nogne bottles available locally. Labeled black IPA, but in many ways an imperial stout with extra hops. Heavy nose of coffee, licorice, butterscotch candies, booze...and hops. Pitch black and oily with greasy tan head. Flavor is burnt grains and burnt brown sugar: mildly sweet and acutely bitter. If youve ever had coffee ice cream (a Rhode Island thing I know) you with recognize the cloying aftertaste. Obviously heavy body, though the hop content pushes it right along. It treats the palate like wake up strips under car tires. When one thinks of the physical attributes of Scandinavia, this beer will fit in context. Imported by the Shelton Brothers.

Bottle shared.  Pours black with a small tan head.  Aroma of burnt malt, chocolate, coffee, pine and light hops.  Same aspects in flavour, moderate sweet and bitter.  Medium body and carbonation.  A really great black IPA.

One of my favorites.
Complex, if i turn it in five times in my mouth it chagnes for every turn. 
Never get bored of this one. Nice nice acidity wich lifts the whole taste experience. - MASTER CLASS!
Butterscotch, rotten eggs, clove, floral, grass, nuts, chocolate, resin, floral, spruce, coffee

The head is robust dark and creamy. The body is black. It is very nice hoppy with a nice combination with a roasty and creamy part. Nice sweet creamy and of course hoppy. I really enjoyed this fantastic beer! 13/13/13/14/14/13

From an old tasting note:
dark ale. Big aroma, super interesting: very pine cones and roasted malts. Big rich colour, creamy flavour but very hoppy with a pine cone bitterness. Very hedonistic brew. Awesome and amazing.

Backlog summer 2011, "Øl og mat festivalen" in Oslo.
On bottle
Black color, good foam
Full bodied & high complexity
Well integrated hops
Very enjoyable

Bottle split with mcberko. Pours solid black with a thick tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, grass, floral notes, grapefruit, perfume, acetone. Flavour of roasted malts, citrus hops, grapefruit with a floral finish. Intriguing flavours, not the easiest to distinguish. Interesting.
Fra fat på DØE festivalen: et interessant øl hvor maltsødmen tas over av en sammensatt bitterhet. Ganske friskt til å være en Dark IPA.

bottled, thanks a bunch to jacob and co. for driving this down to pilsen. unlike my company, it didnt disappoint. black and intense looking with a rich medium brown head; aroma of molasses and freshly laid bitumen with some lurking pine resin and instant coffee; lush mouthfeel with an intensiity of burnt toast bitterness and hints of bitter chocolate. gorgeous stuff

Bottled.Thanks Jacob.Pours pitch black with a beautiful creamy tan head.Aroma of chocolate,coffee,raisin,with flavors of,raw sugar,spice,honey,licorice,peach,molasses,,loads of hops and roasted coffee beans..Great stuff!

Draft at spuyten duvil with Andrew, Brendan, Erica. Pours a dark black body with thin brown lacing. Aroma is fresh hop and chocolate. Mouthfeel is smooth with notes of sweet chocolate, malts, and fresh hops.
On tap at spuytin duyvil.  Nose of lychee... Burnt malts.  Hops, cocoa, burnt melts, slight cocoa.

Botella de 500ml.Copa de Vino.Saboreada en jul´11.Color casi negro, caoba oscuro a contraluz.La espuma,de burbuja pequeña y color marrón claro,conforma una corona amplia,persistente,densa y copiosa con anillos espumosos.Aromas florales,de maltas tostadas, pino,lúpulo y matices de menta fresca.Se encuentran sabores moderados de maltas tostadas,lúpulos,especiado subyacente,toques de cacao y caramelo.Pero el ascendente sabor de lúpulo gana la partida,mientras el ABV queda bien oculto.Cuerpo y carbonatación medios.Final amargo lígeramente aguado.notas de café y resinas en el retrogusto. Bastante buena asimilación.Sabor pleno y refrescante. 500ml bottle.Oversized glass.Enjoyed on jul´11.Quite black color,dark mahogany to the light. Light brown,small bubbled,froth forms a copious, lasting,thick & dense crown.Foamy rings.Floral,toasted malt,piney hop aromas,fresh mint hues.Found flavors are moderate toasted malts,hops & underlying spices,hints of cocoa & candies.But increasing hoppy flavor win the match while ABV remains well hidden.Medium body, medium carbonation.Bitter slightly watery finish.Coffee notes & resiny sensation on the aftertaste.Pretty good drinkability.Flavorful & refreshing.

Half liter bottle from Rays in Tosa. Pours pitch black with a nice tan head. Terrific lacing. Aroma has a strong bittersweet dark chocolate and nice grassy hop blend. Some anise. Taste brings a fine roasted malt, chocolate, black licorice, some tar. Salty sweet. Some thickness. The chocolate presence is subtly behind everything. Some alcohol existence, although not in the flavor. Finishes with some length; strong and flavorfully bitter. Very nice!

500ml bottle from Wine and Cheese Place poured into a shaker. Pours black with two fingers of dark brown head. Aroma of citrus, grapefruit, caramel and honey. So far it looks like an imperial stout and smells like an IIPA. Taste is medium bitter. Lots of citrus hops with a huge amount of roasty malt. Like a porter that dresses up in his big sisters clothes...this beer isnt sure what it wants to be. Full bodied with a thick texture. Lively carbonation and a long bitter finish. Overall, this one is great. I would love to try this again some time in the future.

Bottle at @ De Molen. Aroma is roasty malt, some hops, but the malt dominates. Flavour is quite bitter, with a sweet roasty finish, you can taste there once was a big hop msack in the face. Nice beer now, but probably awesome when fresh.

2010, not exactly what you want in a black IPA, but its worth a try.  Pours black with a small tan head.  Nose is heavy chocolate, coffee and licorice.  smells great.  Taste is more chocolate with very little bitter.  Oddly enough, it tastes great, more like a stout than an IPA.   Mouthfeel is creamy and slick, leaves a wonderful aftertaste.  I should probably rate this lower as it doesnt keep with the style of a Black IPA, but I also have to consider that it is 2 years old.  So I will go in the middle.  Very good after two years.

Nose is hops and sweet malts, some caramel. Dark beer with light brown head. Taste is nice malts, some raisin and some hops. Nice full-bodied beer, soft but really fine carbonation.

Brewdate of 27-5-2010 probably made this beer far less hoppy than expected. Still a very nice one!

Solid dark, small tan head. Raisin, grainy, cake and sticky. Tasty, but sharp and stays the same throughout the palate. Roasted notes, short finish. Could do with some extra malty base and spiciness. (At the De Molen brewery tasting.)

Bottle at monthly tasting @ De Molen. 1,5 years old bottle. Dark pour, foamy tan head. Aroma is roasty, quite hoppy, raisins, yeasty, some chocolate and licorice. Flavor is bitter, some resin and raisins, malty roasted and some old hops. Would possibly have been better fresh.

From a bottle. Pours near black with brown head. Aroma is big with, chocolate, coffee, pine and resin, little soapy. Similar taste, massive flavour, lots going on, very rich chocolate and coffee with plenty of hops. Thick palate, sweet with a bitter finish. More like a hoppy imperial stout. Very well executed.

Bottle 50 cl from erzbierschof.ch. All black poured with a nice tan head. Malted roasted aromas with aromatic hops. There is some toffy and licorice too, dark bitter chocolate and acidity. The taste is roasted malt, cocoa, toast burned, enhanced with resined bitterness, licorice-molasses and wet wood. Body average, ideal texture, elegant balance between all the elements. Final on rather long and earthy notes with a bitterness of burned and oily hop.

Bottle of 50 cl. Black beer with a medium light brown head of good duration. Aroma of toasted with roasted malt with notes of licorice and chocolate and grapfrugt. Sweet and dry taste, and some bitterness after hard roasted malt. Long dry and bitter aftertaste perhaps a bit harsh in taste.

500 mL bottle.  I wasnt so sure about this one at first, but it grew on me.  Looks the part, and smells like a black IPA with added roast.  No hint of booze, and not as big as some of the Americans.  Tastes like a porter with lotsa hops.  Very smooth; not harsh at all.  Perhaps the way this style should be done.

Bottled. Almost black colour, medium sized creamy head has nice tan colour. Aroma is a mixture of piney/citrusy hops and chocolatey/coffeyish. Sweetish, toasted malt notes, some dark caramel and charred barley husks. Some fruitiness. Bitterish finish with chocolate notes and dryish bready maltiness. Maybe slightly sweetish. Sliky smooth texture, low carbonation. Good stuff.

500mL bottle, split with Matts_Property, pours a total black with a thick tan head - looks more like a robust porter or stout. Aroma of intensely rich roasted malts, burnt espresso and harsh citrus hops - beautiful on the nose. Flavour is more roasty than anything, with rich roasted malt, dark roasted espresso, some subtle tangy fruits, molasses, then the hops blast through on the finish, leaving a roasty / hoppy finish with high astringency. Palate is more like a thick porter or stout with a ton of hops. A bit harsh, but thats what I expect from an Imperial Black IPA - delicious.

Bottle shared by akevitt.  Pours an opaque, dark brown body with a thick brown foam head.  Aroma of burnt malts, cocoa, licorice, and some light hops.  Taste is mainly cocoa powder and burnt malts with a slight taste of grapefruity hops near the finish.  Dry palate; odd, abrupt, bittersweet finish.  Lingering bitter cocoa aftertaste.  Not very hoppy for the style, but our bottle was 1+ years old.  Really this tastes more like a nice rich dry stout.

Rating #660, en flaske købt i Toft Vin på Islands Brygge  

Dette her er en øl jeg har villet prøve i en rum tid, men af en eller anden grund alligevel altid har fået undgået når jeg har været på ølindkøb. Nå, men her blev den endelig skænket op i godt selskab sammen med Troels, Frank og Brian før Svartsot i Magasinet i Nakskov. Der er tale om en sortbrun øl med kun en smule skum. Duften er igen overraskende nok ost og chokolade som i den Boris Royale vi lige havde drukket, men dertil kommer en røvfuld aromahumle og hiver dig op fra underverdenen af imperial stouts. Smagen er også gennempræget af blomsterhumle, og selvfølgelig kaffe og chokolade som det hører sig hjemme i en BIPA. Godt bitter afslutning. Medium tyngde.

(bottle - 500 ml) Dark pour with ruby red highlights and a puffy tan head. Very mild hop aroma with a mixture of some light chocolate hints. Flavor starts off with a perfect blend of chocolate, coffee and hop bitterness. Smooth middle and a very well blended finish of hops and chocolate. A bit of bitterness lingers on the palate.
Bottle from Metro. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of hops, citrus, chocolate and roasted malt.

500 ml bottle from Holiday Wine Cellar ($8.79).  Pours pitch black with lots of floaties and two full fingers of frothy-creamy brown head with good retention.  Aroma of dark malts and smoky chocolate along with lesser fruity hop notes.  Flavor of hard roasted malts, dark creamy chocolate, and ash along with some hop tones of citrus and pine.  Dry finish with some lingering bitterness from the roastiness rather than the hops.  This leans noticeably more toward the stout/porter side than the IPA side.  But the flavor is nicely complex and good.  (371, 637)

My Bottom Line :  
This complex brew sports a complex array of aromas and flavors amongst which bloom raisins, roasted cereals, chocolate, caramel, molasses and bitter, resinous hops. 

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A veil of foam skirts the brown-hued blackness.
-The malt profile shares lineage with the great Hill Farmstead Everett and Olfabrikken Porter.
-Drinkability is relatively high even though the flavors are rather intense.
-The resinous hop bitterness becomes drying after a while.
-The quiet carbonation lets the flavors dominate the mouthfeel.

Bottle.
Molt bona cervesa. Bon color, bona retenció descuma, carbònic fi i agradable final sec, llarg i llupolat.

0,5 l. bottle, 2009 "vintage", batch # 407. Black colour with a beige head. Bittersweet aroma of licorice, roasted malts and hops.  Medium sweet taste with tons of licorice. Hops are definitely there, but somewhat subdued. Medium to full body, smooth, oliy texture with a soft carbonation. The porter/stout style dominates more than the IPA style - maybe due to the age of this bottle. I´d like to try a fresh one. This is still a big beer.

Bottle from Only Rare Beers in Budapest.  I thought this was RAD.  Pours roasted black with a large brown head.  Smells and tastes aggressively of bitter cocoa, sweet malts, and citrus forward hops.  Reminded me a lot of Darkness, actually.  The best Black IPA I have yet to try.

Joint tasting with Strykzone. Pour black with foamy tan head with good retention. Good lacing. Nose of roasted malts and citrus. Medium body and a smooth creamy mouthfeel. Flavor is roasted chocolate malts with hops that provide both flavor and some bitterness. Very nice in all regards.

Bottle from Hayduke.  We had it together via facebook chat.  This poured thick and black with a huge tan head that had very good retention.  The nose was chocolate, and citrus hops.  The flavor was both of those, too.  Early, the hops lead and they tasted citrus.  That was a bit of a challenge as the chocolate tended to take out those nuances.  Later, chocolate took charge and this became a hoppy stout.  Alcohol was tasted and was the only detriment here.  This was very tasty and smooth.  Often this style is an IPA that is dark or has a bit of roasted notes.  Not this one.  It is full of chocolate and goes well beyond others.

A bottle of batch 509 @ benzai. Opage black with a nice brown head. Smells hoppy (citrus) and chocolate. Tastes hoppy, chocolate and roasty. Very round flavour, full body and great carbo. 
Great beer! Not the best of the best but definately enjoyable.

Beer Here Dark Hops -pullossa on hauska etiketti. Itse olut näyttää mustalta, hieman öljyiseltä. Olussa on runsas, vaalean ruskea vaahto. Tuoksu on havuinen, kahvinen ja suklainen. Myös makua täytyy kuvailla noilla termeillä. Sen lisäksi tämä on katkera, kuiva ja hieman makea. Erittäin miellyttävä olutkokemus.

Zitroniger Maracujaduft, vermengt mit röstmalzigen Kaffeearomen. Süßlicher Antrunk, stark röstmalzig, verbrannt. Mitte malzröstig, schöne Schokoladennoten, bitter zugreifend. Abgang sehr dicht Schokoladenmalz, Röstigkeit und trockenbitter. Super!

big tan head, lasting sustained, nice lacing, very dark, some brown notes at the edges... big aroma, fruits and roast dominate, smells more imperial stoutish than black ipa ish, a little alcoholic ... lively medium full bodied, burnt flavor, tobacco, possibly even ash, some mild chocolate notes, some coffee, not many hops present.. This is really really good, the smoke/ash is different, but when its called dark hops, hops should be the defining flavor, and they are not... perhaps its an old bottle...

Bottle @ home, shared with Dutchdrebus. Totally black opaque color, small brown head. Smell hops, lightly roasty and some chocolate. Taste roasty, chocolate and hops: nice! Medium to full carbo, medium body.
650ml bottle, that poured a jet black with a tan head.  Aromas of chocolate, malt, and a touch of citrus.  Taste follows the aroma with a licorice aftertaste.
Chocolate, licorice, grapefruit and almost a candy note. Reminds me of gelatins candy with a nice balance. Dry finish and quite big.
Sweet, chocolate, then burnt oats and earth.  Some notes of hops after that on this black beer with mocha head.  Smokey, roasted, grain.  Not much bitter or hops.  Strange but good.

Bottle, batch 509, brewed 270510.
Black with a large, paler cappucino head.
Aroma: chocolate, roasted malt, creamy, citrus.
Taste: licorice, chocolate, citrus, pine, some resin, roasted malt, creamy, not very bitter. The finish is resiny and quite dry.
Quite full-bodied with above medium carbonation.
Not the freshest bottle, so must have lost some of the hop punch, but still very nice.

bottle at Waldo Pizza, KC- pours brownish black, brief brown head. lots of sedimentation. nose of "burning tires", bittersweet chocolate, vanilla, roasted malts. rich, roasted malts with resinous hops, big hoppy bitterness, chocolate, molasses flavors. this beer is downright chewy yet has a slightly fluffy mouthfeel.

08/05 0.5 l bottle courtesy of ogivlado, great thanks for sharing, and giving away the bottle to decorate my room! Well it poured pitch black body with medium sized brown head. Dark malt dominated aroma, caramel and coffee mostly with herbal and orange hops. Slightly acidic scent. Similar flavor, coffee, chocolate, caramel, licorice, touch of alcohol, herbal hop bitterness, somewhat peppery. Creamy texture, full bodied, with long sweetish finish which surprisingly didnt show hops unlike the flavor. A good black IPA, liked it.

THOUGHTS: Impressed once again by Beer Here. Nothing to complex. Very well balanced with that little something extra to set it apart from the pack. And I think that little something extra might be licorice.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a very dark brown that was opaque black in the glass with a large, light brown head that stuck around for a long while and left good lacing. The aroma was very nice, but a little weaker than I expected. There was moderate to heavy dark chocolate and roasted malts; medium to heavy pine hops and lighter citrus hops; slight cherry and slight licorice. The initial flavor was moderate to heavily sweet and moderately bitter; while the finish was moderately sweet, heavily bitter, lightly salty and lightly sour. There was chocolate, pine hops, dark chocolate, cream, slight vanilla, chocolate syrup, very rich chocolate mousse, licorice, chocolate ice-cream and a little citrus hops. The medium to full body was creamy with fairly fizzy carbonation and a slightly chalky and lightly alcoholic finish.
Bottle @ Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Originally rated on 24.9.2010. Nice black IPA with a lot of hops and roasted malts.

Pours dark black, as dark or even darker than some Imperial Stouts Ive had, with 2 finger rich, frothy, small-bubbled tan head.  Aroma is flawless.  MASSIVE notes of coffee and bittersweet chocolate (maybe even vanilla?) interweave with hints of citrus, pine, and resin. Flavor is chocolate cake, green piney hops, then coffee, roast, spice, and a hint of grapefruit peel on the finish. Body is full with lively carbonation, creamy, and finishes dry and bitter.  The flavor of this divine liquid linger on for minutes between sips.  Folks, when I tell you this is everything I could ever want in a beer, I kid you not.  This is unreal.  Legendary.  I aspire to ever be able to brew something like this myself.

Bottle. Black with medium mocca foam. Intensiv hoppy licorice aroma. Well balanced bittesweet finish with strong malt flavours. Very intensiv brew. Like it with pesto waffles smoked salmon and red onions.

Bottle @ home. Deep black appearance with a dark brown head. Rich chocolate malty, mild to moderately piney hoppy nose. Dark, thick chocolate malty, bitter, piney hoppy flavor. Very tasty chocolate flavor with a fairly big hoppy taste.

Bottle from Belmont Station - Pours black with a tan head.  Strong aroma of roasted barley with a hint of coffee.  Very smooth taste.  Hint of hops, but it doesnt smack you in the taste buds like Id expect from the style.  A bit creamy and kinda sweet.
Bottle thanks to logan for sharing. Poured thick black with small tan head. Aroma is of chocolate malts and light hops. More hops come through in the flavour. Very well done.

thinking this may have been an older bottle as the hops seemed faded. nevertheless still a very good beer. lovely roasty flavours throughout and surprisingly drinkable. the bitterness seemed faded as well but there was still some. overall still a great beer.

After having this beer Im not sure its the correct classification but thats for a difference discussion.  The pour is black with beige head. Aroma is nutty roasty and light piney hops.  Taste is doughy roasted and slightly hopped.  The hops are not as pronounced as I would want in a Black IPA but nonetheless its a good beer.
Bottle, pours a nice black, smells is hoppy and the dark malts, taste is mostly dark roasty malts with some light amount of hops. Really was very tasty stuff.

Coffee hops and roasted malt aroma with a cola brown pour and a tan head.  Amazing lacing porter-like body with a pervasive coffee, roasted malt flavor with hints of chocolate and a hop finish.  One of the best Ive had in a while.
Smells like a Danish stout with some hops, very creamy. To s of weaker European hops add bitterness in the finish. Delicious!
Bottle. Pours near black with a tan head. Roasted malty aroma with fruity citric hops. Strong roasted malt flavor with bitter citric hops and a lasting roasty and bitter finish. Quite good.

my first black IPA, really nice, smooth like a thin medium stout, but full of hoppy aroma and flavour, coffe and slight roasted malt in the taste, light bitterness. Really good and easy to drink, alcohol not noticeable. Looking forward to trying other black IPas! Best Beer Here by far (have tried 4 types).

This has the appearance of a very opaque Imperial Stout and the aroma is of very green hops, with a complex mixture of citrus and lemons.  The taste is of green hops and has a mixture of fruit, citrus and a kick of imperial stout vinous malt in the flavor, with a dryness in the middle.  Very complex beer thats hard to categorize but very good either way.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2013 Bottle at De Klomp. Appearance: Dark brown/black liquid with medium tan head. Aroma isnt that hoppy and more malty, has notes of molasses, burnt, smokey, piney, perfume, and leather. Taste: dark chocolate, espresso. Medium bitterness and little sweetness. Heavily bodied with long lingering finish. I quite liked it, but this bottle was almost 2½ years old, which isnt exactly optimal for a BIPA... 7/4/7/4/16 => 3.8
 
Re-rating 2012-01-09. Draught. Clear black liquid with medium light tan head. Aroma of citrus, tangerine, light ash, licorice, coffee and pine. Taste is dry and medium bitter with notes of light ash, coffee, licorice and some citrus. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Totally a different beer than the one I tried earlier. Up the overall by 1 and the aroma as well.

Pours black from bottle with an inch of brown foam. Big notes of dark chocolate on the nose. Medium mouthfeel with some carbonation. Tastes rather smooth and complex. Not a lot of hop flavor or bitterness. Lots of roasted malt on the tongue. Finishes clean. Hides its 8.5% well.

Bottle at Lincoln WInes. Oily black with a dark brown head. Aroma is strong roasted malt and chocolate. The flavor is sweet with lots of coffee, chocolate,and  roasted malt. The finish is almost burnt, a bitter, roasted finish. I dont really get any hop flavor or bitterness, but the layers of roasted malt is wonderful.
Bottle shared. Black, thick tanned head. Aroma of zests, citrus, grass and some roasted malts.  Taste has also caramel malt and smoke, some sweetness. Feel is quite oily. Good hoppy bitter finish

Black color/ rich tan head. Pine sap, mild floral hop smell with sugared up black coffee. Smooth medium mouthfeel. Nice pine sap, citrus hop flavors with black coffee, white sugar, dirt, ash, dry black malt, sweet dark chocolate flavors--very good
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Bottle (50cl) at Øl og Mat 2011 (Oslo). Black colour, beige head. Bittersweet aroma of licorice, roasted malt and hops. More black than IPA, Id say. Medium/full body, smooth, soft carbonation. Fairly sweet taste with loads of licorice. Hops are definitely there, but somewhat in the background - which might be a good thing, since this brew appears more coherent than other black IPAs Ive tasted.

Im Antrunk ist das Bier harmonisch malzig und hopfig zu gleichem Anteil. Der Hopfen gerät dabei zunehmend in Bedrängnis während das Malz sich ausweitet und brotige Züge annimmt. Zum Ende wieder hopfiger, dabei aber kaum bitter. Ein harmonisches und ausgewogenes Bier mit angenehmer Hopfung. 12/9/9/10/11/10

22oz bottle from Supermarket liquors in Fort Collins 
Appearance: Black with a medium sized creamy tan head and good lacing 
Aroma: Roasted malts and cocoa 
Taste: Roasted malts, coffee and chocolate with a bitter dry finish 
A nice beer. Not much hop presence, more of an imperial stout.
UPDATED: JUN 4, 2011 Nearly jet black with mocha head that has a somewhat red quality to it. Dark coffee notes mingled with resinous hoppiness. A very impressive brew.
17th May 2009Copenhagen beer festival. Opaque black beer with a tan head. Smooth sweet dark malty beer with very well blended nettley hops. Soft and semi dry palate. Tasty Black IPA!

Csak a jó sör, Budapest. Ennek aztán tényleg fekete színe van, semmilyen fény nem töri meg. Nagyon komoly habot fejleszt, ami ráadásul kitartó, néhány milliméter erejéig végig meg is marad, állagra meg olyan mintha csak egy habos kakaó tetején lenne. Illata kávélikőrös és kakaókrémes, mintha egy kávés-csokis mousse lenne. Íze kávés, csokikrémes, aszalt gyümölcsös és sajátosan komlós, azonban inkább csak olyan barátságosan keserű, egyenesen keserédesnek mondható. Nagyon száraz, szolidan szénsavas és igazán testes, olajos sör, amelyik inkább egy jóféle imperial stout-hoz áll közelebb, mint egy ipa-hoz.

Bottled 500ml. -Pitch black coloured, medium sized brown head, roasty and slight alcoholic nose with hint of hops. Roasted malt, chocolate and hops with quite alcoholic but pleasant notes. Bitter roasty finish. Well balanced black IPA.

Bottle; Pour is dark brown with a frothy khaki head that retains well in this snifter; light spotty lacing is present, but little else. This brew is roasty, chocolate, fruity, with a mild hop presence on the nose. This brew is bitter on the tongue, creamy from the head, roasted barlet, chocolate, fruity, spicy, and the hop presence is clearly present, though certainly not dominant. I found this brew to be quite similar to the stone version. The hop presence isnt heavy, but I really enjoyed the balance, overall. Very nice.

16.9 oz pours black with tan ring of head. Smells of dark roasted malt, chocolate, molasses but not very much hops. Dark roasted coffee, chocolate, very little citrus and some creaminess. Mouthfell is thin and finish is medium in length and roasted bitter.

Heh, everyone loved the label on this one (even the non beer people that saw it :)). Courtesy of ogivlado who shared it with me and heavy. Poured a black body tinged with amber. Ochre head, small. Malty soft nose, propolis, sticky, slightly roasty, kinda nice. Soft roasty taste with light herbal notes, creamy. Not much notes on this one, they end with this sentence: "Not a proper Black IPA, but a lovely beer."

Pours black with a creme head.  Rich milk chocolate, roast malt, and a slight bit of hops giving citrus fruits in the nose.  Chocolate, citrus hops, roast coffee with a thin mouthfeel.  In the middle, it turns a bit watery, but the finish is nice with chocolate.  The hops are really missing in this though, not near enough to be a good rendition of a  IPA.

50cl bottle. Pours very dark brown almost black. Aroma is vinous and hoppy with sizable maltiness and touches of fruit and chocolatey dark malts. Flavor follows the aroma -- very rich and malty with a very pleasant pungent hop character on top. Balanced chocolatey finish, somewhat dry. Overall, very good.

Bottle: Literally black, bigger creamy and lacy tanned head; sicyherbal hops in the nose, covering stouty aromas like vanilla, leather and tobacco; strong dry bitter-sweet flavour, full bodied; ashy aromas in the imperial-stout-like finish. Pleasant and good, but not superb.......

Excellent. This is how a BIPA should be made. Full chocolate/espresso body with strong, though not bracing tropical fruit finish. Everything about this screams of scandinavian minimalism - using what you have to best effect and creating a product that is the sum of all parts.

Bottle from Olbutikken, Copenhagen. Black pour with a generous tan head.  Some nice roast and fragrant hop character evident in the nose. Similar story in the flavour with some tasty chocolate and fruit lurking also. Dry bitter finish. Enjoyable stuff. Really dig this style.

scura schiuma abbondante buona persitenza leggermente grossolana naso piuttosto intenso con note di tostature e luppoli americanbi aromatici in bocca buona secchezza inizio tostato caffe liquirizia final eluppolato aromatic ben amara piu da luppolo
From a bottle poured a black color with a large amount of head.  Burnt toasted malty flavor with a lingering aftertaste.

Bottle. This is a black IPA! Pour is oily black with huge frothy tan head that  fades to a sticky film with decent lacing. Aroma is pungent hop and vegetable and a roasted malt note. Taste is nice creamy spice with a subtle bitter hops and coco and coffee, very interesting. Palate is full and creamy with good carbonation and finishes chaulky. Really interesting brew.

Black pour with a big tan head. The head sticks around and leaves a thick coating on the glass. Chunks of yeast can be seen floating around. Smells of hops and some hops. Roasted grains, and chocolate in the nose as well. Front bitterness followed by some roasted character. A sweet roasted flavor in the back end. Very good beer. More of a stout than an IPA. The only thing making it lean more towards the IPA spectrum is lack of body.

Funny label, is it supposed to be Men In Black? LOL.  Either way, beer pours like a nice stout with a nice brown head but with chunky yeast in the bottom that makes the beer look unattractive. Well, it is bottle conditioned. The aroma is of roasted malts, chocolate and hops. The taste is pretty much a very hoppy stout. You get the roasted malts, chocolate and coffee flavors of a stout along with piney hops and some light citrus. Finishig off with some bitternes that last a bit. The beer is very complex with both the flavors of a stout and a IPA. This one is very good.  I will look for it again.

(bottle) Looks like a Stout: black as tar coloured hue with a brown, dense and tall foamy head. Rich and roasted malty aroma with chocolate, leather, mocha and a distinctively herbal and spicy hoppy touch. Sweet and roasty bitter flavour, full bodied with a soft carbonation. Stout-like taste with hearty roasted malt and notes of chocolate, leather and a tinge of vanilla; moderately sweet and roasty bitter finish with herbal hoppy notes lingering into the aftertaste. More an (Imp.) Stout than an IPA. 06.IV.11

Pours ink black with two fingers of creamy chestnut brown head. Nose is a bit off, some acetaldehyde and paper, bitter chocolate and coffee with some black strap molasses. Reminds me of a dry stout. Flavor is similar, dark bitter chocolate and coffee with some molasses and a compounding of grain and hop bitterness. Full viscous body with a coating mouthfeel.

500ml bottle from Julios. 
Appearance : Pitch black with a big creamy brown head. Lots of lacing. Awesome look.

Aroma : Rich roasted malt with resinous and oily hops. Light citrusy and piny. Light rubber. Light floral notes. Light fruits.

Taste : Lots of resinous hops with roasted maly. Light coffee on finish with roasted malt and oily resinous hops. Finish quite fruity. Finish is quite bitter and very resinous. Nice soft carbonation.

Overall : Very nice one. Im not such a big fan of black ipas but this is a good one.
Draft. One of the best balck ipas ive ever had. Fresh hoppy flavors or grapefruit and pine mixed great with roasty flavors of malt, coffee and dark chocolate. Deep, rich, complex and satisfying

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2014 Bottle from Mane Liquor. First one to get this beauty ! Pours black with a big three finger tan head. Head retention is fantastic. Great lacing. Aroma of coffee, raw hops and herbal notes. The taste brings out the big hoppy notes with some coffee and chocolatein there. Palate is amazing. This beer is awesome
(Bottle 16/3) Dark with a nice brown head. This is just a good stout with a lot hops.
Pitch black with ok head. Very sweet hoppy aroma. Tase is also sweet hops with a mild bitterness. Well balanced beer.

Nice frothy chocolate head dark pour mild carbonation aroma pine grapefruit caramel chocolate light floral flavour coffee resinous pine citrus bitter lemon grapefruit apricot peach light yeast rewarding on the palate aftertastes resinous fruity good maltiness lasting good flavours and bitter
Bottle from KC. It poured a dark black with a thin tan head. The aroma was citrus hops, chocolate, caramel and alcohol. The flavor was citrus hops, roast, toffee. Not bad.
Very dark brown, like black. Ok head. Smell is hops, grassy, spiced. A bit sweet. Taste is sweet bitter hops, sugar, spices, very nice combined sweetness an bitterness. Good brew.

Pours black with a 2 finger tan head that has great retention and leaves nice lacing. Aroma is surprisingly big on roast, lots of pine and a little citrus hops, molasses, coffee and a touch of milk chocolate. Flavor is roast, heavy roasted nuts and char up front, leading to big piney hops, dark caramel, a little bready and peppery yeast. Ethanol bite and bitter citrus to the finish. Palate is medium bodied and dry throughout with a medium, but sharp carbonation and somewhat astringent finish. The carbonation seems to wash out the flavor experience a bit. Really good beer, seems more stout (imperial, maybe) like than IPA like to me. It could use a little less astringency and carbonation, would definitely get higher marks from me.

Pours black with a large lasting tan head.
Nose shows plenty of roasted malt with hints of ground coffee and dark chocolate. In the background theres piney and resinous hops.
Very similar flavours but rather sweet with big syrupy character. Very full-on.
Rich slick mouthfeel with low carbonation that really could be upped a bit.

Bomber.  Black body, tan head of large proportions, lasting, lots of sticky lace all over the glass.  Beautiful on the pour like a nice stout.  Malty aroma of molasses, chocolate, and also a fair amount of hops, but definitely subdued by all of that roasted malt.  Mouth is fairly lightweight yet full, somewhat creamy, lightly carbonated with a wet finish.  Flavor is lightly sweet, chocolate, molasses, toasted malt, caramel, toffee, and a long hop finish mixed with said dark malts that boasts a strong grapefruit rind splash leading the charge.  Not really my style.  Great malt profile for a stout or Istout, but needs to age significantly (1-2yrs+) to be suitable there.  As far as black IPAs go, its my second, and second favorite.  Smells great.  Flavor is harsh, almost astringent, as the hops cut through the dark malts...and those malts are so heavy and thick...its just not my thing in this case.  Even cutting the malts back would help so the hops could take more of a front seat instead of fighting in the back...not a huge fan with it in this state.  Palate is from creamy and nice to wet and sticky.  Still fairly easy to drink.

Bottle. Thick dark brown pour with a foamy, lasting tan head that leaves a lot of lacing. Aroma is very hoppy with lots of pine, mint, grass and citrus, as well as notes of toffee, dark chocolate, brown bread, coffee and liquorice. Flavour is still very hoppy but less so than the aroma, with more grapefruit and lime plus pine and herbs, but the roastiness comes through a lot more with notes of coffee, cocoa, liquorice and smoke. Fairly thick, oily mouthfeel with lively carbonation and a lingering roasty,, bitter finish. To me this really nails the Black IPA style, robust and harmoniously balanced; very nice, easy to drink and well-integrated alcohol.

Aroma is that of unsweetened chocolate and hops. The appearance is very dark like an imperial stout with a darker head. The taste is similar to the aroma except there is the addition of an espresso flavor to go along with the more prolific hop and chocolate flavors. Good beer, however it doesnt have the hop kick I was hoping for, the thickness of the beer takes some away from that, almost seems like an imperial stout that has been heavily hopped.

500ml bottle courtesy of jtclockwork as part of free beer contest week! thanks, james! pours like a big ol imperial stout, oily and thick, with a two-finger, creamy, dark beige head with solid retention and great lacing. aroma is great, again like a big ol imperial stout, with bitter dark chocolate, brownies, and roasted malt backed by grassy, herbal hops, orange peel, and coffee with hints of toffee and wet soil. flavor is delicious as well with huge roasted coffee, dark, burnt malts, and dry, bitter chocolate backed by light, subtle citrus hops, grass, and a touch of spicy pine with a hint of sweet molasses and fig on the back end. palate is rich and on the fuller side of medium bodied with crisp carbonation and a long, dry, roasted, bitter finish. overall, a great beer but lets be honest, this is a dry-hopped imperial stout through and through, not a black IPA.

Bottle @ Nabokjelleren, Bergen. Pours a pitch black body with a thick, creamy caramel head. Im such a sucker for those... :-) Aroma is yeasty dark fruits, chocolate, roasted malts and coffee. Taste is even more coffee, with undercurrents of black berries, licorice, hints of cinnamon and grass. Medium body. Something doesnt quite work for me with this though, cant really put my finger on it but...oh well. This is still a pretty nice and rather original beer - even for a black IPA, a genre that is notoriously original in itself.

0.5l bottle @ Naboen, Bergen. Pours a black body with a big two fingersized everlasting tanned head. Nose is chocolate, quite distinct grassy hops along with some grassy herbs. "Oheo" this was different! Strong coffee beans, weak chocolate on the top of all those piny hops. Slightly warming, full-bodied and discreet carbonation. Ends in a malty, hopy and lightly dry finish. I always get surprised when drinking black ipas, and with this in quite a good way.

Bottle. Black with a large light tan head that never quite disappears. Aroma of grapefruit, pine, chocolate, singed malt, nectarines. Taste is fairly sweet with citrus and a little roasted bitterness - a it like dark chocolate flavoured with grapefruit. Some coffee and stone fruits too. A little rye grainy sourness. Medium bodied. Alcohol sticks out a little at the end along with chocolate and citrus. With all that going on it could be a thumping mess, but although its not exactly harmonious the disparate flavours dont clash. They do, however, obscure each other a bit.

Bottle 500ml at 1337 beer#5 courtesy of Meilby. Pours black with brown head. Aroma is caramel, chocolate, coffee, grass, alcohol. Taste is medium bitter, light sweet. Medium to full body, oily, average carbonation. 26022011

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2016 Bottle, september 26th 2015. Black body with a small beige head. Aroma is roasty with a strong hop fruitiness. Taste of mild chocolate, strong coffee, grapefruit, mild pine. Bitter and fruity finish. A very nice CDA, bringing back good memories to the first time I tried it, as my first cda, and was blown away by the style crossover.

Bottle 500ml @ 1337 Beer #5
[Trade by fonefan] Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of coffee, caramel, roasted malt and some hops. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long chocolate finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Long neck, 50cl bottle.  From the moment of the pour, "Oh, my Lord!"  Thick, viscous, jet black with a soapy foam, chocolate milk - brown head.  Aroma of woody hops, scents of pine straw, burnt grains, licorice, earth, a pile of autumn leaves, and good amount of basil.  Flavor is a bit chalky, burnt grains, unsweetened molassas, wood, West Coast hops, some citrus peel. Mostly burnt flavors.  Some coffee and dark chocolate.  Black malt heaven.  Finishes very dry, lots of burnt flavors.  ABV is very well hidden.  I will try this beer again and again as long as it stays available.  Try this, it is a mind blowing, palate dominator!  

8,5,7,4,19

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2012 160311:@DØE Århus Syd Black IPA tasting: Dark hoppy strongale which tastes more like an Imperial stout. Much litter acid and is somewhat out of balance. but is really still a good beer..

Black with a dark brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, dark chocolate and hoppy - grapefruit. Flavor is rather sweet and rather bitter. Dry, roasted and bitter finish. Very well balanced. Excellent. 160211

Bottle.  Very dark brown pour, thick short tan head.  Lots of sweet chocolate, a bit of roasted malt, caramel, citrus, and bitter hops in the finish.  Not really that hoppy.  I guess it is now the cool thing to make strong stouts with some hops and call them black IPAs.  Im not complaining though, this is quite tasty.

Quick-review; Black colour, dark foam, almost brown.
Hoppy nose, burned coffee, alittle unbalanced, good carbonation, medium+ body

bottle shared with 4 friends. 
Very hoppy smell.  An unusual beer.  Quite bitter.  Interesting

Blacker than black beer with a huge and creamy cappucino-brown foam. Pine, lemon, grape, licorice and roasted malt on the nose and in the mouth also tones of coffee and a rather harsh, but well proportioned bitterness from the hops, that works extremely well with the roasted, burned tones. A modern favorite of mine

Thick-set dark beige/brown head over jet-black beer, pouring near-solid. Thick, voluptuous aroma with alcohol, C- hops, dry hessian sacks and full cacao chocolate. Very burnt/roasted with a full, again chocolatey finish. Dry coffee, hops, Haagse Hopjes . Full-bodied, very slick, filling. Ow - this is serious stuff. Impressive!  Thanks to J & C !

Dark brown-black with tan head.  Aroma is roasted malts, burnt rubber, and some hops that are mostly drown out by the roast.  Flavor is very roast with some noticeable hopping that is residual.  Finishes dry and with malt and hop bitterness.  Not altogether smooth and a bit hard to drink.  Could showcase the hops better.

on tap @ Fork & Barrell - pours an inky black (though lighting is so dim in here even the lager looked black...) with citrusy piney hop aromas.  Flavor tastes like a decent IPA with a tiny bit of roasted malts.  Nice hop profile if you like the pine & citrus.

A: The pour is a very dark brown with a small mocha colored head.

S: The nose centers around the roasted and specialty malts. Lots of roasted malt, some mild chocolate, grassy hops, and a very mild citrus.

T: Like many of the black IPAs, this is decently hoppy with some citrus and pine hops, but the roasted malts really take over. A decent bitterness, both from the hops and the malts, but mediocre overall as far as the style goes and a bit more toward the chocolate side.

M: The body is medium with a slight creaminess on the tongue. Medium in terms of carbonation, too.

D: Not really my favorite in terms of Black IPAs. Decent flavors, but sort of lackluster.

Draft at Blue Monk, Buffalo, NY. Darker pour, almost a deep maroon brown. Heavy roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate. Hops seem somewhat lost amonst the heavy roastiness. Bitterness shows up more in the finish. Tasty, nice complexity but expecting more hop flavor.

To be honest, Im not sure what a Black IPA is supposed to taste like, but to me it leans more towards the "Black" than the "IPA" (in other words it tastes more like a hoppy Porter than a malty IPA).  The flavors develop nicely from beginning to end...starts off with a lot of floral notes and then finishes with a sort of malty chocolate.  I cant think of a beer off hand that is both this floral and malty, but the transition works quite well.  A pretty fun and unique beer if nothing else.

27-Sep-10 (500-ml bottle: Purchased 31-Dec-09 for $7.49 at www.wineandcheeseplace.com)  The Black IPA style is still in its infancy, but Black Hops is one of the finest example of this style Ive ever tried.  What separates this beer from most others in the style is that despite loads of dark-roasted malt and hops, the bitterness level is moderate; most examples combine strong, roasty bitterness with astringent hop bitterness for a beer that bludgeons the palate.  Aromas of dark chocolate cake, licorice, earth, decaying logs, molasses, and pine needles lead into flavors of pure cacao, coffee, molasses, burnt toast, earth and prunes, with finishing flavors of smoke and ashtray.  Piney hops manage to balance the malt-driven flavors perfectly, lending medium-high bitterness.  Softly carbonated, full bodied, slightly viscous, and fairly sweet on the palate, yet dry in the finish.  Black in color and fully opaque, the beer sports a full inch of creamy, light-brown head that settles slowly to a thin layer while leaving patches of lace on the glass.  Black sludge coats the bottom of the bottle.  Just an excellent beer.

Defines the category and the black IPA. My personal point of reference. Aroma and taste bear slight notes of smoke derived from the chocolate malt and the coffee nuts I assume are a part of this magnificent beer. Easy compares to and/or beats the best works of Three Floyds and Mikkeller. No matter the mood, no matter where in the world, no matter the weather or time of the day - Id get this if its on tap. I promise itll be love at first sight.

Dark brown / black pour. Citrus and spicy hops, light choclate, toffee and some earthy notes in the aroma. Flavor is loaded with citrus hops, light chocolate and malt.  Bill used his wang as a baseball card.

Bottled 50cl. Ordered from www.erzbierschof.ch. It pours a very dark beer with a nicely remaining lacing creamy beige head. Great aroma of citrusy hops, dark chocolate, strong coffee, herbs (sage, basil ?!) and vanilla. Vegetal. Good bitterness. Great hop profile. Medium to full bodied. Chocolatey. Dry bitter finish which makes you eager to take another sip. Excellent and very delicious. A great example of the style. Impressive.

Black pour with a huge tan head. Lots of earthy evergreen hop notes with citrus in the background- the malt character is defined by roasty chocolate, caramel, and lactic cream. The flavor holds a ton of cocoa nib and roasted malts with coffee and chocolate abounding. The hop character holds more earthy citrus and evergreen. The palate is thick and rich with a roasty finish. More like a stout, but delicious just the same.

Pours a dark espresso color with a thick body and a large foamy brown head. Notes of apricots, roasted coffee, chocolate, fruit syrup, and smoke. Great dark yet fruity beer. HIghly drinkable and packs a puch.

Pours pitch black and a creamy dark brown head with hints of ruby. Nose is bittersweet chocolate, coffee, and piny hops. Very rich and full mouth feel with tons a delicious hops pounding the tongue all the way through the swallow. I thought this was fantastic.

12/10/10 notes: Bottle, aged about 6 months. Pours thick and black with one of the darkest heads Ive seen. Nose has yeast, ash, meaty smoke, sappy pine. Flavor oozes out with roasts, black coffee, burnt toffee.  Aggressive even with this age, would love to try it fresh.

bottle shared by bbb63.  thanks mike!   aroma of herbal piney, grassy hops with a bright anise twang.  some mollasses and roasted, earthy, grainy booze.    really nice hoppy stout beer.   burnt earthy, cocoa.   pretty nice stuff.  well made.   liked a lot.

Tasted from a 500mL bottle purchased at Discount Liquor in Milwaukee. There is not a date that I can find on the bottle.  Pours thick oil black, looks like an imperial stout, with a thick tan head that leaves huge rocky lace.  The nose is darkly roasted malt with molasses, hops and coffee bitterness, and a heavy dose of milk chocolate.  The flavor is a very beautiful marriage of milk chocolate, with molasses, coffee and hops bitterness.  The hops come through as slightly resinous with grapefruit peel, while the darkly roasted malts, chocolate, and coffee back everything up.  The body is full and creamy, with average carbonation, and a long resin hops with molasses and coffee finish.
A nice beer but wouldnt drink lots of it. Dont think I will buy this again even though the overall experience was good

Bottle and served in my GI IPA tulip: Jet black with a beautiful rocky and frothy light brown head which left very nice lace upon the glassware. The aroma is dank resiny piney hops in a sandwich of dark chocolate. leather baseball glove, smoked  ham meat and wrapped in cavendish tobacco leaves. Yes, I just had a boner and it was good!  The taste is lush sweet chocolate and charred black malts fighting for play with the dank and fruity hops yet in the end peace is achieved and harmony is found all over my palate. Me so f**king happy right now. Cygnus the God of Balance would be proud and proclaim this an otherworldly experiance! This brew has layers of earthy goodness that simply rocks it out. Hoppy enough not to be a Imperial Porter or Stout, it is very much akin to fresh Alpha Klaus but with more body and bitterness. Best of all is that while some ashy and chalky character is found on the palate, this brew is oh so drinkable and oh so smooth. Damn dangerous this is. I have had more than a few Black IPAs and this sets a benchmark for the new and expanding genre. Beer Here Please! (I need to contact them and see if they will do a homebrew recipe for me,  this blows my homebrew Black IPA right out the of water, and that is the biggest compliment I can give this beer) Damn, just damn, I am floored.

Pours black with an off-white head. Smells hoppy and slightly toasted. Sweet with some bitterness. First you are met by hoppy aromas of exotic fruits. Later toasted malts. Medium bodied. Medium to high carbonation.
The look is dark brown in color, dark, and has a biege colored head. The smell is malts, hops and roasty.
Nose of licorice, dry, fresh hops, late cereal, feel is medium, carb, too. Taste is salt, some burnt malt, late alcohol bite

Koromfekete színe van, aminek a tetején egy olyan színű és állagú hab terpeszkedik, mint a legjobb minőségű habos kakaókon szokott trónolni. Ez a habkorona rendkívül kitartó és olyan érdekes módon olvadozik. Először nagy buborékok keletkeznek benne, amik szétpukkanásukkal mindig eltüntetnek egy darabot belőle, de a legaljával már nem bírnak. Illata erőteljes, finom fajta kávélikőrrel feljavított forró csokoládéhoz hasonlatos, ami belengi az egész szobát. Belekortyolva egyből érezzük a frissen pörkölt kávébabot, nagyon magas kakaótartalmú fekete csokit, gyomorkeserűkben használt titokzatos fűszereket, keserű narancsot, és a rengeteg komló finom, fenyős, gyantás aromáját. Haraphatóan testes és olajos és tele van pezsgő kis buborékokkal. A magasabb alkoholtartalom csak akkor kúszik belőle elő, ha már jobban felmelegedett. Utóíze virágos, nagyon száraz és olyan, mintha egy fatüzelésű kemencében készített pizza, kissé túlsütött és megpörkölődött szélét rágcsálnánk. Nagyon különleges és finom főzet, igen étvágygerjesztő és megalkuvást nemismerő keserűséggel és igen összetett ízzel. Olyan, mintha egy imperial stout és egy DIPA törvénytelen gyermeke lenne. Klasszikus!
Inte så mycket som påminner mig om IPA, men heller lite år porter-hållet. Ganska tjock, oljig, rostat malt, humle, lite choklad och kaffe. En aning klibbig, men mycket trevlig sak.

On tap at Håndverkerstuene. Pitch black colour. Very small head. Aroma is both hoppy and malty at the same time. Notes of alcohol and coffee. Flavour is malty with heavy notes of roasted malts, roasted coffee and some hops. Some spices. Medium long aftertaste.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2014 Aroma of Hops, grass and earth but you can smell some darkness in it too. You get english liquorice, chocolate and other stout notes in the taste. But it ends with bitterness and dryness from the hops.

This is a strange one. I was definitely expecting a black ipa and i got a foreign extra stout instead. this is so different compared to southern tier iniquity, stone sublimely self rightous, or 21st amendment back in black. you can taste the ipa in the others where in this one all you can taste is the roasted malts like a traditional extra stout. a little dissapointed due to the fact that i have started to love black ipas and was really looking forward to this. if youre like me and thinking this is going to be a great black ipa i hate to disapoint you, but its not. its a good stout. surprise!

Bottle thanks to Papsoe. Pours a very oily jet black with a smallish dark tan coloured head. Reminds me of a stout more than a black ipa. Good looking beer all the same. Aromas of dark chocolate, a little licorice and pine / resiny hops. Was expecting more hops but I am not complaining. Flavours are brilliant with some dark chocolate, espresso coffee, roasted malt and resiny hops. Great stuff. Fullish mouthfeel. Really enjoyed this one.

Brought to a recent tasting. When I opened the bottle I expected there to be a good amount of hop character, but the beer looked exactly like a stout. It has a pitch black pour with a syrup like thickness. A dark brown head quickly formed after the pour and I got a good amount of malt aromas. I did get the hop aroma in there as well, but not as much as I was expecting. The taste had flavors of roasted barley and dark chocolate. Good carbonation and good head retention. Cant complain about this one.

Bottle pours dark black with enormous brown creamy head, nice lacing. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, espresso, behind these are hints of pine and citrus. Taste has smoked and roasted flavors, chocolate, espresso, nuts, vanilla, balanced bitterness all the way through, faint hints of pine in the finish. Overall very decent and enjoyable.

From notes - fresh 500ml bottle consumed soon after U.S. import.  Pours nearly black at first glance, showing truer hues of dark mahogany upon closer inspection.  Theres a slight translucency at the edges.  A moderate head of smooth, whipped, light brown foam gives skinny snakes and small spots of lacing.  Bold, resinous, piny hops leap from the glass, leading the aromatic charge, followed by bits of earth and dry roast.  Beneath, notes of cocoa powder and dried caramel comprise the malt base.  Flavors follow suit, replicating the Cascadian style of the Pacific Northwest very closely.  Rich, bittersweet cocoa roast is met with just a little burnt caramel sweetness, as the sharp, resinous pine hops add ample bitter character.  Toasty bread and some dried molasses also come through.  The palate is slightly more substantive than medium bodied, and the carbonation is moderate and primarily dry.  Biting pine hop resins grip the tongue well after the finish.  Overall, a very fine example of the hoppy stout/black IPA category.  Right up there with the best examples that Ive had.

Bottle. Pours looking like a nice stout almost, half-finger of tan head, rich dark brown nearing on black.  Sweet aroma at first then get a sharp hop kick that nears on astringent.  Roasted malts and a bit of chocolate.  Flavor is not as hoppy as suggested in the aroma, bit grassy and get a good deal of chocolate maltiness at point.  Medium body with vibrant carbonation.  Not bad, but better out there in the style.

On tap at Olympen, pours black with a big foamy tan head. Nose is coffee, dark chocolate. taste is rye, chocolate, coffee, lots of coffee, also some bready notes. tingly mouthfeel. Nice noticable hop balances the big roasted malt. Kinda wish there was even more hops but it does find a nice harmony in this beer.

500 ml bottle from Wine and Cheese Place, shared at The Royale.  Pours a very dark brown color, near black, with a small brown head.  Aroma of chocolate malts, cocoa powder, roasted marshmallow, earth, molasses, peat, and surprisingly (given the hop head Men In Black looking guys on the front, not to mention the style of this) no hops to speak of.  The same holds true for the flavor, with rich chocolate, roasted malts, peat, earth, burnt toast, yeast, and brown sugar.  The body is medium- if it were a little fuller this would resemble an imperial stout even more closely- with low carbonation.  Dank, peaty mouthfeel.  Reminds me a lot of a foreign stout in a lot of ways; upon smelling, I knew right away this was from Northern Europe somewhere and it absolutely reminded me of a few Nogne O brews Ive had.  Good beer, but maybe it was a little older than intended because the hops just werent there.

black with a brown head. dank and damp soggy hop nose; oily ink and soy sauce with a touch of smoke from the røgmalt. yeast gives it a cocoa powder angle. chocolate is heavy, smoke is light (dampened by the yeast), zues hops are chalky and pungent, and with the slight oiliness and sweetness of the malt, they appear soggy, peaty and dank.  the sogginess is something I seem to crave, and appreciate in some IPAs, of course Your mileage may vary.  its an interesting display in a style Im beginning to see great promise in.
