Pitch black colour, mediumsized beigeish brown head. Aroma is chocolate, some mild hops and quite much nuttyness and slight fruityness lruking in the background. Flavour is quite much roasted malts, some soour wooden notes as well as mmild grassyness. Pleasantly balanced.

Bottled. Thanks Baggio!!! Pours out in a an opaque black colour with a rich lasting tan-coloured foam. Loads of piney, grapefruity and resinous hops in the aroma with touches of roasted malts and caramel. Full-bodied with strong notes of of pepper, black chocolate, espresso, lemon-zest and resin. Long hop-bitter finish of resin, grass. grapefruit, crackers and black chocolate. An uncompromising brew that takes your breath away. Quite brilliant stuff!

Bottled, thanks Baggio!  Completely black. Huge on grapefruit and asphalt. Dry and tarry .Full bodied with dense mouthfeel. A spanking flavour of condensed asphalt grapefruit. Hugely bitter finish. A beer that sticks out!

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2010 Bottled. Pours black with a huge, tan head. Good laings. Nose of hops, pine  and roasted malts. Flavour with chocolate, liqourice, roasted malt and smoky notes. Full bodied. Pleasant bitter finish. Great.

Truly an awsome beer! Black look with a thick long lasting brown head, leaving lacings. Aroma holds overwhelming amounts of piney hops, drinking it fresh seems like a good idea! Under the pine comes notes of mild chocolate, liquirce and some smoked wood. Flavor is fresh and smooth for a beer this dark. Again loads of pine in the moutharoma along with smooth milky chocolate. Medium hop bitter, a little roasted and a great chocolate cane sugery sweetness. Wont be my last, thats for sure!

Bottled @ København Ølfestival 2009. Aroma has some piney citric hops and liquorice. Black coloured beer with a brown head. The taste is sweet with some bitterness of the hops, some dark chocolate, bit roasted.  Interesting brew.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours completely opaque black with a tiny, off-white head. Hard roasted malt with some aroma hops. Quite full-bodied with hard roasted malts, dried fruit, a little ashes and a fairly hoppy finish. Interesting. 160509
KØ09. Mild grassy hop aroma. Black colour. The flavour is sweet and hoppy. Some sweet dark malts, hint of liquorice. Mild and slightly peppery.

Bottle shared by Anker. Dark brown almost black body with a dark brown head. Roasty and hoppy aroma with coffee notes. Flavour is hoppy grapefruit, grass, roasted malt, coffee and a little smoke. Full bodied. This is another great brew from CSA.

At CBF 2009, Valby.
Dark brown. Aroma heavy malty (roasted, dark fruits, chocloate) and hoppy (citrus). Flavor moderate to heavy sweet and bitter. Medium to full body. I lke ti!
Draught. Black colour with a medium brown head. Rich complex aroma and taste of roasted malts, licorice and coffee with a nice lasting hoppy finish.

Bottled. Thanks to Anders Holmskär. 
Black colour with huge head. The hoparoma is intense, with hard, grassy, green, almost pepper-like hops. Due to the hard (dry)hopping, the darker malts get less outspoken. Here is licorice most prominent. Flavour brings more maltiness. Big licorice, along with dakr, peppery chocolate. The attenuation seems a bit low, just like the Ølfabrikken brews. Thats not a problem with me, as long as the beers are this tasty. Good hoppy flavour along with a solid bitter finish. On a first glance, I would call this an Imperial Porter, just like the heavily hopped Gonzo. Great beer nevertheless!

Bottle. Black with huge brown head. Aroma fresh hopy wit a little sweetness and after a while roasted malts. Taste roasted malts a little coffee and some hops to finish things off. Palate thick and syrupy. Another interesting beer from Beer Here. Somewhere on the border between American strong ale and Imperial Stout by my opinion, but the brewer says ASA. Lorteøllene er efterladt hos Ølfabrikken, og de gode fortsætter hos Beer Here.

CBF09. Draught. Frothy white fair mostly deminishing head. Black colour. Heavy malty and hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter light sweet flavor. Bolcher-notes. Long great complex heavy bitter finish. Great creamy palate. Wonderfull beer.

Bottle. Thanks to Enjoyit. Pours black with a firm light brown head. Some lacing. Aroma is roasted with pine hops; like a mix of a stout and an (I)IPA. Well-balanced and very nice. Flavour is pretty much like the aroma; again; well-balanced and very nice. Finish is a lingering bitterness with roasted and tart notes. Soft palate with a touch of too much carbonation; otherwise very good. A beer like this could have been quite cloying in the long run, but surprisingly isnt at all. A great beer. 22-05-09.
Sample at CPH beerfestival. Nice head with good duration. Color is roast malt, hops, coffee and bitter chocolate.
Botella. Black colour. Hoppy bitter roasty pleasant aroma. The flavour has roasted malt and plenty of bitter hops with pine, coffee and chocolate. Dry roasty hoppy piney chocolate finish.

Bottle at KBH Festival, 2009. Pitch black with a creamy brown head. Nose is citrussy hops and coffee. Slick, oily, vinous, smooth and full bodied. Coffee and chocolate with fresh hops underneath. Interesting and very nice.
Black colour with medium beige head.Aroma of rosted malt rye and bitter hops.Well balanced and with hint of chocolate.

Bottle @ Ølfestival, Valby, 2009.
Pours almost black with a small, fizzy, off-white head. Aroma is very roasted with some flowery hops that are actually quite subdued. Medium carbonation and a fine, creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is bitter, hard roasted malts, hops, dryness, flowery, grassy and some pine. Slightly burning, vinious finish.

(Bottle) Pours black with a large, creamy brown head. The aroma is heavily (dry) hopped with a striking green profile of resiny wood, dry grapefruit, earth and sticky cannabis alongside mild herbal and mild floral hints. The roasted malt brings dry tones of liquorice, tar, coffee and some dark chocolate. A whisper of smoke and spicy rye is also present. A typical Danish nose with boat loads of roast and hops. Some hints of brown sugar make the aroma more complex. The flavour is lightly sweet, lightly acidic and medium to heavily bitter. Tones of resin, wood, grapefruit, flowers, coffee, brown sugar, asphalt, tar and liquorice. The mouthfeel is soft, round and light creamy with light to medium carbonation. Citric resiny hops and roast lingers. Medium to full bodied. Pretty much like an old Ølfabrikken beer - but on hop crack. Nice.

Flaske: Dejlig humlet duft på en sort øl, med et lille skumhoved. Urtet smag, efter et par mundfulde til, ekstrem urtet smag. Trækker virkelig ned på drikbarheden og er ærgeligt på noget der lovede så godt.

Bottle. High and lasting brown head. Pitch black body. Roasted barley malt aroma. Choccolate coffee flavor with smoke and spicy notes. Flavor of coffee choccolate liquorice grass and a fair amount of hops bitterness. Low carbonation. Long bitter aftertaste. Alcohol percentage seems right.

Bottle at Olbutikken on launch day. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma has chocolate and dark roasted notes with ever present hops. Flavor is complex, hops, smoked, chocolate and other notes. Quite good.

Bottle at Ølbutikken - Launch day. Black - brown head. High burned, high hoppy, high bitterness, chocolate, sharpness, light sweetness, coffee, flowery hoppy, licorice, high malty, pine needles, grass. High bitter finish.

50 cL bottle. Pours dark brown to almost black with a huge, chocolate brown and slowly collapsing head. Roasted malt, dark chocolate and quite hoppy and mild fruity aroma. Flavour is thick chocolate, roasted to light smoked and a slight subdued sweetness. Distinct marmelade like hops note with a light citrusy touch. Bitter, light citric and chocolate flavoured finish.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2009 Bottle at Ølbutikken and at Andreasen11. 
Pours pitch black with a large and foamy, long lasting light brown head. 
A nice aroma of fresh hops hits your nose at first, followed by roasted malt, liquorice and chocolate.
Flavour is roasty and very hoppy with strong notes of liquorice, ending up in a long bitter liquorice finish. 
Great beer!

bottle at Ølbutikken. Huge brown head. Good display of lacework. Pitch black color. Strong mix of roasted og hoppy notes. Roasted malt, coffee, floral, grapefruit, dark chocolate. Full bodied, average carbonation, dry thick texture. Heavy bitter and sweet flaver. Linkering roasted hoppy bitter finish.

Bottle in Ølbutikken.
Black coloured with a huge beige head.
Roasted and hoppy aroma of pine needles and liquorice.
Roasted and hoppy flavour of pine needles, hops and dark chocolate.
Roasted and hoppy finish.

bottle at ølbutikken launch party, cph.
pours black, small brown head.
aroma is very hoppy, roasted grains, coffee. aroma is like a real good stout, just a lot hoppier at the same time. flavor is licorice, faint sweetness, lots of roasted grains. a high score, but then-it hits home with my personal taste on the hoppy as well as the stouty side.
